Comment:
Most people think of founder‚Äìmarket fit as alignment.
I think of it as inevitability. 
When a founder is born inside the problem ‚Äî when their scars, upbringing, and survival instincts are shaped by the same forces the market is wrestling with then building the company is not a choice, it‚Äôs a compulsion.That kind of founder doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúsearch‚Äù for product-market fit.
They live it, almost unconsciously.
Because while investors look at fit as a strategy, the real moat is identity.
You can copy a product. You can copy a playbook.
But you cannot copy the life that forged the founder.
